page.title: 10Visiting Well & Nosterfield
page.content: Although near main roads Well is not on a direct route to the Dales and is often missed unless there is a specific purpose in coming. Visitors still seek the Roman villa, producing a map to locate it,but the remains are buried and a modern bungalow covers the site.A fragment of mosaic pavement is displayed in the church which is well worth a visit.It has a Norman south porch and the typical Neville square topped windows in the south wall and medieval stained glass family arms in an east window.The carved wooden font cover is said to be the second oldest in Britain, 1352, graffiti dated 1618 on a tomb. Two homes offer bed and breakfast,and the Well Ox is non-residential.Noster- field on the B6267 is better placed and meals are served at the Freemason's Arms.
